hackathon-description-text: LA Hacks is a weekend dedicated to you and 999 other students in Pauley Pavilion. Collaborate and build creative solutions to problems, while pushing the limits of your mind and body to make something amazing.
hackathon-eligibility: LA Hacks focuses primarily on undergraduate and graduate students but accepts high school students and recent grads (1-2 years out) on a case-by-case basis. Dropouts who would otherwise currently be in college are cool too.
hackathon-requirements: Make sure your submission title starts with your table number in the form "T# Project Name" otherwise we won't be able to assign judges to you and you may not be considered for any of the prizes.
hackathon-rules:
- YOU MUST BE AT LA HACKS TO WORK ON A PROJECT FOR SUBMISSION
- You cannot work on your project before hacking begins (which is officially 11:00pm PT on Friday, April 3rd) 
- You cannot steal another team's source code
- The decision of judges is final for determining prizes and awards
- Make sure your submission title starts with your table number in the form "T# Project Name" otherwise we won't be able to assign judges to you and you may not be considered for any of the prizes.
- Please comply with all instructions from LA Hacks organizers
